title: How to Make Gluten Free Potato Lasagna

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (180°C) and spray a 9-inch baking pan with nonstick cooking spray.
Set the nonstick skillet over medium heat as you slice the sausage casing open lengthwise using a knife.
Push the meat through the opening and into the skillet.
Repeat this process for the other sausage.
Use a spatula to break up the meat into small pieces as it begins to cook.
Add the onion to the skillet and cook the mixture for 10 minutes until both the sausages and onions are browned.
Mix the ricotta, the dried basil or Italian seasoning, and the egg white in a bowl using a spoon.
Place 1/2 cup marinara sauce in the baking dish, spreading it over the bottom of the dish using a flat plastic spatula.
Place 1/3 of the potato slices over the marinara, leaving no gaps.
Drop 1/2 of the ricotta mixture over the potatoes and spread the mixture over the potatoes with the plastic spatula.
Sprinkle with 1/3 of the mozzarella cheese and 1/2 of the sausage and onion mixture.
Add 1/2 cup more of the sauce and spread it evenly over the layer.
Top with potato, ricotta, mozzarella, and the sausage and onion layers in sequence.
Top the lasagna with the last layer of potatoes, the remaining marinara sauce and the remaining mozzarella.
Cover the dish with foil and bake the dish for 45 minutes or until the lasagna is bubbly.
Uncover the dish and bake it for five more minutes or until the cheese on top is browned and bubbly.
Serve on plates or in shallow bowls.
steps.description: Garnish each serving of the dish with a basil leaf, if desired.

text: Prepare the Lasagna Components Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (180°C) and spray a 9-inch baking pan with nonstick cooking spray.  Set the nonstick skillet over medium heat as you slice the sausage casing open lengthwise using a knife.  Push the meat through the opening and into the skillet.  Repeat this process for the other sausage.  Use a spatula to break up the meat into small pieces as it begins to cook.  Add the onion to the skillet and cook the mixture for 10 minutes until both the sausages and onions are browned. Set the nonstick skillet aside. Mix the ricotta, the dried basil or Italian seasoning, and the egg white in a bowl using a spoon.  Assemble the Lasagna Place 1/2 cup marinara sauce in the baking dish, spreading it over the bottom of the dish using a flat plastic spatula.  Place 1/3 of the potato slices over the marinara, leaving no gaps.  Drop 1/2 of the ricotta mixture over the potatoes and spread the mixture over the potatoes with the plastic spatula.  Sprinkle with 1/3 of the mozzarella cheese and 1/2 of the sausage and onion mixture.  Add 1/2 cup more of the sauce and spread it evenly over the layer.  Top with potato, ricotta, mozzarella, and the sausage and onion layers in sequence.  Top the lasagna with the last layer of potatoes, the remaining marinara sauce and the remaining mozzarella.  Bake and Serve the Lasagna Cover the dish with foil and bake the dish for 45 minutes or until the lasagna is bubbly.  Uncover the dish and bake it for five more minutes or until the cheese on top is browned and bubbly.  Serve on plates or in shallow bowls. Garnish each serving of the dish with a basil leaf, if desired.
